intro: Galium betetae, commonly known as betony galium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its stems are slender and often prostrate, allowing it to spread along the ground. Galium betetae is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
